name: Wizard Specialty Spell Schools and Sorcerers / Bards
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
During playtesting of a Sorcerer / Wizard build (Arcane Spell-Battery) I discovered that:

- My Sorceress could learn and cast Mass Haste and scribe it onto scrolls
- Despite having Enchantment as a prohibited school from Wizard (Illusion Spell School Specialist)
- She could not cast Mass Haste from a scroll however

I suspect it might apply to Bards too. What about classes with memorized spells like Clerics / Druids?

I note this was not mentioned in the NWN Wiki: Spell School or Talk section.

Thought I would share and see if anyone else has other experiences with this? Interested to know.

 

Here's a screenshot of the log, the scroll I scribed (which I could not cast), and my character sheet with the school of magic visible.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content: That's how specialization normally works, the spell school restriction only applies to scrolls and Wizard spells. Spells from other classes or non-scroll items are unaffected. [https://nwn.fandom.com/wiki/Spell_school]

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks Yunim for looking into this.

However read the text on the Wiki page carefully Yunim. I referenced the wiki page in my original post plus the Talk section:
A wizard may choose to specialize in a school of magic, thereby gaining one additional spell slot per spell level while losing the ability to cast spells from an opposed school. This prohibition extends to spells cast from scrolls, but not to spells cast from other kinds of items. In addition, specialist wizards have a bonus (+2) to identifying spells (through spellcraft) from their area of expertise and a penalty (-5) to identifying spells from the opposing school. Alternatively, a wizard may choose to not specialize, thus keeping access to all spells.
Nowhere in the current Wiki post is there a reference to whether taking a specialty school allows casting from usually prohibited spells from a different class such as Sorcerer as a memorized spell.

So this could be a new piece of information, or the Wiki is missing this piece of information or is unclear. 

It affects builds which take a specialty wizard class along with another caster class. 

I am curious if players have noticed this mechanic before?

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content: Then the wiki should be edited for clarity, this is how specialization worked in 1.69 as well.
